intro: Galium × ochroleucum var. guillemotii, commonly known as the white wood-sorrel, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically valuable species in its native range.
